intro: Cyclonema sylvaticum, commonly known as the forest cyclonema, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Cyclonema sylvaticum is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
